replies.msg: 趁1號差少少1001開定2號先

重post general reminder：

1) 記得要小心審題
啲人往往唔中point就係因為寫晒一大堆看似相關嘅point，但係實際上唔係答緊題目。
例如2015Paper 2 Q1(biii) 題目叫你Explain why there is an increase in blood flow to the skin during exercise. 有人答左significance/importance of increase in blood flow to the skin，而唔係答reason for the increase in blood flow to the skin.

2) 記得留意題目提示字眼(hints)
原理同第一點一樣，你必須扣題作答先會有分。
而某部分題目會有一啲提示字眼，例如但不限於With reference to.../Based on...。其實提示字眼已經隱含左答題方向，而通常你從答案中反映到你有用hints，你係會拎到分。
例如2016Paper 2 Q4(ai) 題目叫你With reference to the roles of neurones and nuerotransmitters, suggest why patients with Parkinson's disease demonstrate the above symptom. 答案total2分，1分係比role of neurone (to produce neurotransmitter)，另1分係比role of transmitter (coordinate voluntary response/muscle contraction/muscle coordination)。

3)留意題目嘅情景(scenario)
同第二點有少少類似，你係要運用個情景比你嘅information去作合理推斷/解釋。
例如2015Paper 2 Q1(aiii2)，佢比左一句statement: HCG prevents the degeneration of yellow body. 問題問 : Based on the action of HCG, explain why the woman did not experience menstruation。你係要base on句statement，然後繼續作推論。
呢題相當容易，但係面對陌生情境(unfamiliar situation)，如果巴打無頭緒嘅話，可以參考下情景比你嘅每一句，然後嘗試作合理推斷/解釋。

點分 chromatids,chromosome and chromatin?

樓主上個po有答過

3. Chromatins: very tiny threads which cannot be seen when the cell is not dividing
Chromotid: one of the copies of the chromosome if the chromosome is replicated.
Chromosome: two chromatids (having two copies of DNA) join together after replication, or just one (having one copies of DNA) after sister chromatids separation


其實上個Post有位Merlot巴打另外有講：
Chromosome係睇centromere。換言之，right after DNA replication，兩個chromatids痴住同一個centromere，所以就視為一個chromosome。Sister chromatids separate之後，每個sister chromatids都有一個centromere，所以喺呢個stage，佢哋係被視為一個chromosome。

2n係指一個生物普通細胞嘅chromosome 狀態
可以係diploid, tetraploid, hexaploid
而n係指佢sex cell嘅chromosome 狀態
2n: Diploid = n: monoploid, 2n: tetraploid = n: diploid
If 2n = Triploid, pentaploid (單數ploidy), 通常就會係sterile

How to test or prove the character is sex linked ？


I think it would be more helpful if you can think it through by yourself. See if you can try out the following question:

2011 AL Paper 2 Q.1(d)
In a family of four, both the father and the mother are normal but both their son and daughter suffer from a genetic disease. Without using genetic diagrams,
(i) deduce whether the genetic defect is a dominant trait or a recessive trait. (4 marks)
(ii) deduce whether the gene for the genetic defect is located on the X-chromosome. (4 marks)

(i )Son has genetic disease so he must bear at least one allele for genetic disease which is inherited from either mother or father.
So at least one of parents must bear one allele for genetic disease. Both parents are normal so they must bear at least one allele for normal condition. Thus at least one of parents is heterozygous, dominant character is expressed under heterozygous condition. Therefore , normal condition is dominant trait while genetic defect is recessive trait.

(ii) father has only one X chromosome and it will be inherited to his daughter. Mother will inherit her one of X chromosome to her daughter too.
The daughter has genetic defect so she must have homozygous recessive trait with bearing two recessive allele for genetic defect on both her X chromosomes. So recessive allele is located on X chromosome.

但第一次減數分裂之後既2個子細胞中既染色體，一條係來自母親，另一條係來自父親，點解唔係2套既？
唉，呢課d野好抽象

因為經過第一次減數分裂，
-> 同源染色體分離
-> 留低姐妹染色單體
-> 你其實細心諗，姐妹染色單體咪即係未變身前既父系或母系染色質
-> 所以我地就會話佢得「一份/一套」染色體 N


最簡單諗：
1. 得番父系/母系既姐妹染色單體

兩套指： 父系 母系兩款「結構遺傳上不同」既染色體

而姐妹染色單體係：結構上/遺傳上相同一樣既複製品

多謝巴打，幫我清左好多概念
想問下，同源染色體配對個下，係咩玩法？
係父系染色體同父系染色體配對，母系染色體同母系染色體配對，定母系同父系染色體配對，又或者系隨機配對？

同源染色體配對；

父系染色體(2條父系相同染色單體)與 母系染色體(2條母系相同染色單體) 一齊「排一齊」

配對還配對：指兩條染色體「一齊排」

但「點樣配對」：out c(我都唔太識）
好似有機制令父/母系染色體自己識別「長度差唔多」既另一同伴(父/母系染色排）
-> 唔係隨機胡亂配

但「點樣排列於赤道/23組同源染色體邊個排前邊個排後」：每一次、每一次減數分裂都唔同。換句話說即係「任意」排列

How to test or prove the character is sex linked ？


I think it would be more helpful if you can think it through by yourself. See if you can try out the following question:

2011 AL Paper 2 Q.1(d)
In a family of four, both the father and the mother are normal but both their son and daughter suffer from a genetic disease. Without using genetic diagrams,
(i) deduce whether the genetic defect is a dominant trait or a recessive trait. (4 marks)
(ii) deduce whether the gene for the genetic defect is located on the X-chromosome. (4 marks)

(i )Son has genetic disease so he must bear at least one allele for genetic disease which is inherited from either mother or father.
So at least one of parents must bear one allele for genetic disease. Both parents are normal so they must bear at least one allele for normal condition. Thus at least one of parents is heterozygous, dominant character is expressed under heterozygous condition. Therefore , normal condition is dominant trait while genetic defect is recessive trait.

(ii) father has only one X chromosome and it will be inherited to his daughter. Mother will inherit her one of X chromosome to her daughter too.
The daughter has genetic defect so she must have homozygous recessive trait with bearing two recessive allele for genetic defect on both her X chromosomes. So recessive allele is located on X chromosome.

(ii) 錯左，it should be located on an autosome as the father do not have the disease, he should have an X-chromosome with normal allele.
If the disease allele is located on X-chromosome, the father must have the disease because he is a male with only one X-chromosome.

How to test or prove the character is sex linked ？


I think it would be more helpful if you can think it through by yourself. See if you can try out the following question:

2011 AL Paper 2 Q.1(d)
In a family of four, both the father and the mother are normal but both their son and daughter suffer from a genetic disease. Without using genetic diagrams,
(i) deduce whether the genetic defect is a dominant trait or a recessive trait. (4 marks)
(ii) deduce whether the gene for the genetic defect is located on the X-chromosome. (4 marks)

(i )Son has genetic disease so he must bear at least one allele for genetic disease which is inherited from either mother or father.
So at least one of parents must bear one allele for genetic disease. Both parents are normal so they must bear at least one allele for normal condition. Thus at least one of parents is heterozygous, dominant character is expressed under heterozygous condition. Therefore , normal condition is dominant trait while genetic defect is recessive trait.

(ii) father has only one X chromosome and it will be inherited to his daughter. Mother will inherit her one of X chromosome to her daughter too.
The daughter has genetic defect so she must have homozygous recessive trait with bearing two recessive allele for genetic defect on both her X chromosomes. So recessive allele is located on X chromosome.



Full marks for (i)

Your deduction in (ii) is incorrect. Because following your logic, if the father pass the only one X-chromosome which contains the allele for the genetic defect to his daughter, this implies the father himself will also have the genetic disease despite the allele for the genetic disease being recessive , because he has the X-chromosome carrying the recessive allele for the genetic defect, which cannot be masked. But the father does not have the disease.

The approach of answering (ii) is similar to 2016 Q5(b).
You first assume the statement (the gene for the genetic defect is located on the X-chromosome) to be true,
then suggest the theorectical outcome based on the fact that the statement is true.
Then point out the fact that the theortical outcome (father has the disease) is contradictory to the actual outcome (father does not have the disease).
Finally, draw your conclusion (the allele for the genetic defect is not located on the X-chromosome)

Normally, it is harder to prove a disease is X-linked than it is not. So you have to bear this approach in mind to solve sex-linkage problem.

Model answer:
If it is X-linked, the daughter should have two recessive alleles for the genetic disease. (1)
One of the X-chromosome bearing the recessive allele must be inherited from her father. (1)
As the father only possess one X-chromosome, he should have manifested the disease if it is X-linked. (1)
However, since the father is normal, the allele for the genetic defect is not located on X-chromosome.


OR


If it is X-linked, the X-chromosome of the father must carry an allele for being normal (1)
which must be inherited to his daughter. (1)
Since the allele for being normal is dominant, the daughter must be normal. (1)
As the daughter has the disease, the allele for the genetic defect is not located on X-chromosome. (1)

Why gene therapy cannot cure dominant disease?

Why gene therapy cannot cure dominant disease?

You should bear in mind that the transferred normal gene is not a replacement of the defective gene. It is used to compensate for the defective gene. If the normal gene is dominant over disease-causing gene, the effect of the disease-causing gene will be masked.

If that is the case, the allele for the genetic defect cannot be dominant, because the dominant allele will still expressed even if a normal gene is introduced.

我知我概念錯咩位 唔該

Why gene therapy cannot cure dominant disease?

You should bear in mind that the transferred normal gene is not a replacement of the defective gene. It is used to compensate for the defective gene. If the normal gene is dominant over disease-causing gene, the effect of the disease-causing gene will be masked.

If that is the case, the allele for the genetic defect cannot be dominant, because the dominant allele will still expressed even if a normal gene is introduced.

Compensate 啫係點？我唔明分別喺係邊？


姐係類似抵消。唔同取代。
生活例子：你嘅長處抵消你嘅短處，唔代表你嘅短處消失左。

如果以 Sickle cell anaemia 為例，即係gene therapy 之後, sickle shaped RBC 依舊produce, 但係正常嘅 RBC 都會produce, 所以抵消左？？


生活例子：你嘅長處抵消你嘅短處，唔代表你嘅短處消失左
長處=normal gene
短處=disease-causing gene
Since normal gene is dominant to the disease-causing gene, the disease-causing gene will still be present in the genome, but it will not express at all.
